instructions: After reading each statement carefully, please select the response which best describes your feelings and actions.
timeframe_instruction: During the past month, how often do you...

questions.text_template: Find that you stay online longer than you intended (for example, {{example}})?

ai_context_guide.examples: scrolling reels instead of studying, watching one more video after work

questions.text_template: Neglect household chores or personal tasks to spend more time online (like {{example}})?

ai_context_guide.examples: putting off laundry to browse social media, skipping meals while gaming

questions.text_template: Prefer the excitement of the internet over spending time with people in person (like {{example}})?

ai_context_guide.examples: choosing to chat online rather than meet friends, staying home to browse instead of going out

questions.text_template: Form new friendships or relationships with people you meet online?

ai_context_guide.examples: connecting with gaming buddies, making friends through social platforms

questions.text_template: Find that others in your life complain about the amount of time you spend online?

ai_context_guide.examples: parents commenting on phone usage, friends saying you're always distracted

questions.text_template: Find that your grades or school work suffer because of the time you spend online (for example, {{example}})?

ai_context_guide.examples: missing assignment deadlines due to distractions, falling behind on projects

questions.text_template: Check your phone or notifications before something else you need to do (like {{example}})?

ai_context_guide.examples: checking Instagram before studying, scrolling before getting out of bed

questions.text_template: Find that your job performance or productivity suffers because of your internet use?

ai_context_guide.examples: browsing social media during work hours, missing deadlines due to online distractions

questions.text_template: Become defensive or secretive when anyone asks you what you do online?

ai_context_guide.examples: hiding your screen when someone approaches, lying about time spent online

questions.text_template: Block out disturbing thoughts about your life with soothing online activities (like {{example}})?

ai_context_guide.examples: watching videos to avoid stress, scrolling to forget problems

questions.text_template: Find yourself anticipating when you will go online again?

ai_context_guide.examples: counting hours until you can check social media, planning your next gaming session

questions.text_template: Fear that life without the internet would be boring, empty, and joyless?

ai_context_guide.examples: feeling anxious without WiFi, worrying about missing online content

questions.text_template: Snap, yell, or act annoyed if someone bothers you while you are online?

ai_context_guide.examples: getting angry when interrupted while browsing, snapping at family during screen time

questions.text_template: Lose sleep because of being online late at night (for example, {{example}})?

ai_context_guide.examples: staying up scrolling through feeds, losing track of time while watching videos

questions.text_template: Feel preoccupied with the internet when offline, or fantasize about being online?

ai_context_guide.examples: thinking about posts while in class, daydreaming about online activities

questions.text_template: Find yourself saying 'just a few more minutes' when you are online?

ai_context_guide.examples: telling yourself one more video, promising to close the app soon

questions.text_template: Try to cut down the amount of time you spend online and fail?

ai_context_guide.examples: setting app limits but overriding them, deleting apps only to reinstall them

questions.text_template: Try to hide how long you've actually been online?

ai_context_guide.examples: clearing browser history, lying about screen time to others

questions.text_template: Choose to spend more time online over going out with others?

ai_context_guide.examples: declining plans to stay home browsing, choosing online gaming over meeting friends

questions.text_template: Feel depressed, moody, or nervous when you are offline, which goes away once you are back online?

ai_context_guide.examples: feeling anxious without internet access, mood improving after going online

default: Your responses suggest a healthy relationship with the internet.
Your usage patterns indicate some mild issues with managing your time online. Consider setting specific time limits for social media or gaming.

Teenager (School-going): Your responses suggest that your internet use is moderately impacting your life. It is a good idea to talk to a school counsellor about this.
Try turning off non-essential notifications on your phone to reduce distractions.
Young Adult (College-going): Your internet use seems to be causing moderate issues. Your college likely has resources to help with time management and digital habits.
Young Professional: Your responses indicate a moderate level of problematic internet use. Speaking with a therapist can provide you with effective strategies to regain control.

default: Your score indicates a severe dependence on the internet. It is strongly recommended that you seek professional help from a therapist or counsellor specializing in addiction.
